  "Allegations" : "IN FEBRUARY 2010, DILIP SHAH WAS ADDED AS A RESPONDENT IN A FINRA ARBITRATION (CASE # 08-03387) THAT WAS ORIGINALLY FILED IN SEPTEMBER 2008 AGAINST CAMBRIDGE LEGACY SECURITIES LLC (\"CAMBRIDGE\"), CAMBRIDGE'S FORMER DIRECTOR OF ALTERNATIVE INVESTMENTS (THE \"DIRECTOR\") AND A FORMER CAMBRIDGE ADVISOR. THE ALLEGATIONS AGAINST MR. SHAH RELATED TO CERTAIN LIMITED PARTNERSHIP INTERESTS PRESENTED TO MR. SHAH'S CLIENTS BY THE DIRECTOR AND THEREAFTER PURCHASED BY CLIENTS.  THE CLAIMANTS ALLEGED THAT THE INVESTMENTS HAD BEEN MISREPRESENTED AND REQUESTED DAMAGES, JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY, AGAINST CAMBRIDGE, MR. SHAH AND THE OTHER RESPONDENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $692,000 PLUS INTEREST. MR. SHAH DENIED ALL CLAIMS MADE AGAINST HIM NOTING THAT EACH OF THE INVESTMENTS WERE CAMBRIDGE-APPROVED PRODUCTS, THE INVESTMENTS HAD BEEN NEGATIVELY IMPACTED BY THE RECENT ECONOMIC DOWNTURN, AND THAT THE CLAIMANTS WERE SOPHISTICATED INVESTORS WHO WERE FULLY INFORMED AND AWARE OF THE POTENTIAL FOR INVESTMENT LOSS RESULTING FROM ECONOMIC CONDITIONS OUTSIDE THE CONTROL OF BOTH CAMBRIDGE AND MR. SHAH.  MR. SHAH HAD FOLLOWED CAMBRIDGE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IN TRANSACTING BUSINESS WITH FULL DISCLOSURES. ON JUNE 15, 2012 THE ARBITRATION PANEL AWARDED ONE OF THE FOUR CLAIMANTS COMPENSATORY DAMAGES OF $18,250 AGAINST MR. SHAH TOGETHER WITH ATTORNEYS FEES IN THE AMOUNT OF $15,000. ALL OTHER RELIEF WAS DENIED AND SUCH CLAIMS WERE DISMISSED.",

THE CLAIMANTS ALLEGED THAT THE INVESTMENTS HAD BEEN MISREPRESENTED AND REQUESTED DAMAGES, JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY, AGAINST CAMBRIDGE, MR.
